task.title: Starting and registering a delegate using a file

taskbody.context: Use this procedure to start a delegate host after upgrading to version . This procedure also includes steps to create a credentials file and to use the file to register the delegate.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Obtain the host ID of the delegate host to start and register.

substep.cmd: Display the host IDs of all hosts.
Record the host ID of the delegate host.

step.cmd: Create authentication credentials for the delegate host.
step.stepxmp: Replace Host-ID with the host ID of the delegate host identified in the preceding step: serviced key reset Host-ID
step.stepresult: The command creates a unique credentials file in the local directory.

step.cmd: Use a file transfer utility such as scp to copy the credentials file to the delegate host.
step.info: Once copied to the delegate host, the credentials file is not needed on the master host and can be deleted.

step.cmd: Log in to the delegate host .
Determine whether serviced is configured to start when the system starts.

choices.choice: If the result is enabled, proceed to the next step.
If the result is disabled, enter the following command: systemctl enable serviced

step.cmd: Start serviced, and then monitor the startup.
step.info: During this startup, serviced invokes docker pull to retrieve its updated images.

stepxmp.codeblock: systemctl start serviced && journalctl -u serviced -f -o cat

step.stepresult: Do not proceed to the next step until the following message is displayed: Host Agent successfully started

step.stepxmp: Replace Credentials-File with the pathname of the credentials file: serviced host register Credentials-File

step.info: The file is no longer needed on the delegate host.
step.stepxmp: Replace Credentials-File with the pathname of the credentials file: rm Credentials-File
